concise_definition: n. 形式, 形状, 表格; v. 形成, 组成, 构成

definitions.explanation_en: The shape or configuration of something, especially as distinct from its material or content; the external appearance or structure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某物的形状或结构，尤其区别于其材质或内容；外部的外观或构造。
definitions.example_en: The sculpture took the form of a human figure.

definitions.explanation_en: A document with blank spaces to be filled in, used for collecting information or making official requests.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用于收集信息或提出正式请求的、带有空白栏的表格。
definitions.example_en: Please fill out this application form before the deadline.
definitions.example_cn: 请在截止日期前填写这份申请表。

definitions.explanation_en: A particular way in which something exists or is expressed, especially in abstract contexts such as ideas, systems, or behaviors.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某事物存在或表达的特定方式，尤其用于抽象语境，如思想、制度或行为。
definitions.example_en: Democracy is one form of government.

definitions.explanation_en: To come into existence or be created, often through the combination or arrangement of parts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过部分的组合或排列而产生或形成。
definitions.example_en: Clouds formed over the horizon as the storm approached.
definitions.example_cn: 随着暴风雨逼近，云层在地平线上形成。

definitions.explanation_en: To organize or constitute something by bringing elements together into a structured whole.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将各个要素组织起来，构成一个有结构的整体。
definitions.example_en: A committee was formed to review the policy changes.
definitions.example_cn: 成立了一个委员会来审查政策变更。

comparison.analysis: “Shape” (形状) 更侧重于物体的外部轮廓或几何结构，通常是可触摸、可视的物理形态，如圆形、方形。而 “form” 含义更广，可指抽象结构、组织方式或存在形式，不仅限于物理外观。
“Structure” (结构) 强调内部组成部分之间的组织关系和系统性，常用于建筑、社会制度或语言体系。而 “form” 更强调外在表现或存在方式，有时可指结构的外在体现，但不一定涉及内部逻辑。
“Type” (类型) 用于分类，强调事物所属的类别或种类，如“这个类型的人”。“Form” 则更强调该类别下的具体表现方式或形态，如“民主是一种政府形式”。前者是分类标签，后者是表现模式。
